author: Staff Reporter
text:
The ‘Mission to Save Avinashilingam Women University’ has sought Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s intervention in the issue related to the government’s financial support for the institution.

In a release, the Mission’s convener K. Selvaraj said that since 1988 the University had remained a public-funded institution receiving about Rs. 50 crore a year from the University Grants Commission.

The Prime Minister’s intervention was necessary to ensure that the university continued its noble objective of providing quality education to women at affordable cost to realise the dreams of its founder Avinashilingam Chettiar, who established it in 1957, the release added.
title: ‘Save University’
